texts.value: Receptor for arginine vasopressin. The activity of this receptor is mediated by G proteins which activate a phosphatidyl-inositol-calcium second messenger system. Involved in social memory formation
Located in cytoplasmic vesicles dispersed throughout the cell cytoplasm and to the plasma membrane
Localized within gonadotropes of the anterior pituitary of the brain. Broadly distributed throughout the cerebral cortex
Palmitoylated on three cysteine residues, of which only two are identified
Overexpression of AVPR1A in the brain increases the duration of social memory
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family. Vasopressin/oxytocin receptor subfamily

features.description: No significant change in affinity for arginine vasopressin or oxytocin. Increased affinity for 1-deamino, D-Arg8-vasopressin.
17-fold increase in affinity for oxytocin. No change in affinity for arginine vasopressin or 1-deamino, D-Arg8-vasopressin.
50-fold decrease in affinity for arginine vasopressin. Little affect on affinity for oxytocin or 1-deamino, D-Arg8-vasopressin.
Reduced palmitoylation, coupling to G protein unaffected. Abolished isoprenylation, coupling to G protein unaffected; when associated with G-372.
Reduced palmitoylation, coupling to G protein unaffected. Abolished isoprenylation, coupling to G protein unaffected; when associated with G-371.

citation.title: Molecular cloning and expression of a rat V1a arginine vasopressin receptor.
Sequence identity between the rat and human vasopressin V1a receptors.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Molecular cloning and expression of rat V1a and V2 arginine vasopressin receptors.
Tyr115 is the key residue for determining agonist selectivity in the V1a vasopressin receptor.
Localization of V1a vasopressin receptor mRNA expression in cultured neurons, astroglia, and oligodendroglia of rat cerebral cortex.
Effect of N-glycosylation on ligand binding affinity of rat V1a vasopressin receptor.
Palmitoylation of the vasopressin V1a receptor reveals different conformational requirements for signaling, agonist-induced receptor phosphorylation, and sequestration.
Immunocytochemical localization of vasopressin v1a receptors in the rat pituitary gonadotropes.
Viral vector-mediated gene transfer of the vole V1a vasopressin receptor in the rat septum: improved social discrimination and active social behaviour.

properties.value: Expressed in liver and 17 other cell types or tissues
P:negative regulation of transmission of nerve impulse
P:positive regulation of cell population proliferation
P:positive regulation of cellular pH reduction
P:positive regulation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration
P:positive regulation of glycogen catabolic process
P:positive regulation of prostaglandin biosynthetic process
P:positive regulation of systemic arterial blood pressure
P:regulation of systemic arterial blood pressure by vasopressin
